newsitem.title: CHINA: China-Vietnam border trade hits 3.136 bln yuan.
newsitem.headline: China-Vietnam border trade hits 3.136 bln yuan.

text.p: Border trade between China's southwestern Guangxi region and Vietnam hit a record 3.136 billion yuan ($378 million) in 1996, up 17.9 percent from the previous year, the China Business Times said on Tuesday.
Trade through deals reached at border fairs soared, with imports up 61 percent to 588 million yuan while exports rose 46.4 percent to 751 million yuan last year, it said.

More than 40 commodities such as copper ore, manganese ore, timber and rubber were imported from Vietnam, and major exports from China included beer, bicycles, sewing machines and cloth, the newspaper said.
